level.heading: Fire safety requirements for high-rise buildings.

level.text: The owner of a high-rise building shall:
Prepare and maintain a fire safety and evacuation plan for the building; and
Conduct fire drills at least once every 12 months.
A violation of this section shall be subject to civil penalties as established by the Mayor pursuant to rulemaking.
For the purposes of this section, the term "high-rise building" shall mean any building having occupied floors more than 75 feet above the lowest level of fire department vehicle access.

level.heading: Legislative History of Law 18-116
level.text: Law 18-116, the "Fire Alarm Notice and Tenant Fire Safety Amendment Act of 2009", was introduced in Council and assigned Bill No. 18-178, which was referred to the Committee on Public Safety and the Judiciary. The bill was adopted on first and second readings on December 1, 2009, and December 15, 2009, respectively. Signed by the Mayor on January 11, 2010, it was assigned Act No. 18-264 and transmitted to both Houses of Congress for its review. D.C. Law 18-116 became effective on March 11, 2010.
